meanings.definition: A condition in which the muscles of the lower esophagus fail to relax, preventing food from passing into the stomach.
meanings.sent1: My uncle has achalasia, so he struggles to eat because his esophagus muscles don't relax properly.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with achalasia after they experienced trouble swallowing food.
meanings.sent3: Why did the esophagus go to therapy? It had achalasia and needed to learn to relax!
meanings.sent4: Her achalasia was like a stubborn door that refused to open for the food trying to enter the stomach.
meanings.sent5: The image of the constricted esophagus in achalasia stuck in my mind like a tangled knot.

meanings.definition: The inability of a muscle or sphincter to relax, leading to difficulty in swallowing.
meanings.sent1: Achalasia can make it hard to enjoy meals when the muscle or sphincter won't relax for swallowing.
meanings.sent2: The elderly man's achalasia made it challenging for him to swallow even small bites of food.
meanings.sent3: Why did the muscle throw a party? It wanted to show it could relax, unlike achalasia!
meanings.sent4: Her achalasia felt like a locked gate, preventing the food from smoothly passing through.
meanings.sent5: The struggle of achalasia was evident as the muscle refused to cooperate with the act of swallowing.
